TopicTitle: Aug. 5th Mars Rover landing, Radio broadcast?

Articles.Content:
I\'ll be on vacation camping during the landing of the Curiosity Rover, so I\'m hoping someone can think of some way I\'ll be able to watch or at least hear how the landing goes?

Worse comes to worse, I guess I could try convince my sister to let me use her phone, but that will be tough.

If that\'s the case, 8pm Eastern is when it lands?
Or when the signals reach Earth?

I\'ll be on vacation camping during the landing of the Curiosity Rover, so I\'m hoping someone can think of some way I\'ll be able to watch or at least hear how the landing goes?

Worse comes to worse, I guess I could try convince my sister to let me use her phone, but that will be tough.

If that\'s the case, 8pm Eastern is when it lands?

Due to them broadcasting it from PDT the landings at like 1 AM. But the show begins 3 and a half hours before the landing.

I\'ll be on vacation camping during the landing of the Curiosity Rover, so I\'m hoping someone can think of some way I\'ll be able to watch or at least hear how the landing goes?

If all else fails, I\'d assume the landing coverage/press conference video(s) will be available shortly after the landing at the NASA TV youtube channel, if only in an edited form.
Yeah...I\'m hoping to be able to watch/hear it live, but if all else fails I\'m sure it will be recorded somewhere like youtube as you said
